definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: I have only a bowing [nodding] acquaintance with him.
I have a nodding acquaintance with him.
A woman who can't forgive should never have more than a nodding acquaintance with a man.
sentences.chinese: 不懂宽恕的妇人永远只能是男人的点头之交。

sentences.english: In consequence, their acquaintance developed into long and profitable friendship.
sentences.chinese: 他们由点头之交变成了长期互利的朋友关系。

sentences.english: Oh, I have been very fortunate, " he said, nodding".
sentences.chinese: 他是点头之交，我连他的名字都不知道。

sentences.english: He is only a nodded acquaintance of mine.
I can't say I know him well, but we have a nodding acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 我不能说我和他很熟，不过我们有点头之交。
我与他仅仅是点头之交。

sentences.english: Again, he is a nodding acquaintance, i don't even know his name.
sentences.chinese: 他是点头之交，我连他的名字都不知道。

sentences.english: John has been a nodding acquaintance of mine for the last seven years.
sentences.chinese: 过去七年，我跟约翰只是点头之交。

sentences.english: Are we on speaking terms, or do we just nod occasionally?
sentences.chinese: 我们关系密切，还是只是点头之交？

sentences.english: I am on nodding terms with him.
Oh, I have been very fortunate, " he said, nodding to himself."
sentences.chinese: 他是点头之交，我连他的名字都不知道。

definition: to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
friendship between gentlemen, insipid as water (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3])
a gentleman's friendship, insipid as water (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3])
pinyin: jun1 zi3 zhi1 jiao1 dan4 ru2 shui3

definition: to be well acquainted with/to know well
